general_advisory: Apply well decomposed Farm Yard Manure/vermicompost during last ploughing in the field. Before raising any crop, go for collection of soil sample and test it in nearby soil testing laboratory. Apply balanced fertilizers in all the crops as per soil test based recommendations mentioned in the soil health card. Farmers are advised to repair the goat house before commencement of winter season because there is a high chance of mortality among kids due to chill weather.

advisory: Continuing harvesting of kharif paddy. Farmers are advised to harvest and process different varieties separately without mixing for better price. Before storing paddy, it should be dried properly.

Farmers are advised to not burn the residue of kharif paddy in the fields because it not only pollutes the environment but also causes severe health (respiratory) problems. Farmers are advised to mix the residue of paddy crop in the soil. It increases soil fertility and can be used as mulching for decreasing soil evaporation and conserving soil moisture.

If 'Rodent/Rats' problem is noticed, locate the rodent burrow in the crop field and surrounding areas. Place Aluminium Phosphide 6% tablet @ One tablet (12 gm) per burrow and seal the burrow with mud.
Prevailing weather condition favors the following pest attack. Follow recommended control measures as required.
To control pod borer, apply Benfuracarb 40% EC @ 1lit/ac or Deltamethrin 2.8% EC @ 200 ml/ac or Spinosad 45% SC @ 60 ml/ac or Flubendiamide 39.35% SC @ 40ml/ac mixed with 200 liters of water.
To control pod sucking bug and aphid, spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 40g/ac or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 60 ml/acre mixed with 200 liters of water.
Apply Oxyflourfen 23.5% EC @ 80ml/acre mixed with 200 liters of water at 2-3 DAS.
Apply Imazethapyr 10% SL @ 3ml/ltr of water within 15 DAS as an early post-emergence herbicide.
Apply Oxadiargyl 6% EC as pre-emergence @ 3ml/ltr of water at 1-2 DAS or Quizalofop-ethyl 5% EC as post-emergence @ 2ml/ltr of water at 15-20 DAS.

To control Dimond back moth, spray bio insecticide Azadiractin 0.03% (300 ppm) @ 5 ml/liter of water or Beauveria bassiana 5% WP @ 800 g/acre mixed with 200 liters of water. To control chemically, spray Fipronil 5% SC @ 2ml/ltr or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 4ml/ltr of water.
To control Tobacco leaf eating caterpillar, spray Cyantraniliprole 10.26% OD @ 6 ml/5ltr of water.
To control the vector of YMV and leaf curling due to aphid infestation in okra, spray Buprofezin 15% + Acephate 35% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water or Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 3 g in 15 liters of water.
To control fruit borer in okra, spray neem-based pesticide 1500 ppm @ 600ml/acre. At later stages spray Spinosad 45% SC @ 70 ml/acre.
Provide sufficient green grass. Lactating animals should be provided with concentrate mix for better production.
Farmers are advised to repair the goat house before commencement of the winter season because there is a high chance of mortality among kids due to chill weather.

Make necessary arrangements to provide heat, especially to chicks during night hours to reduce the mortality rate. Make proper brooding arrangement for chicks. Keep the poultry house clean and clamp free.
